com.jayway.restassured.config

Class XmlConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jayway.restassured.config.XmlConfig
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Config

    public class XmlConfig
extends Object
implements Config
    Allows you to configure properties of XML and HTML parsing.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      XmlConfig()
      Create a new instance of XmlConfig without any features and that is namespace unaware.

      • feature

        public XmlConfig feature(String uri,
                         boolean enabled)
        Set a value of a feature flag.
        Parameters:
        uri - The feature name, which is a fully-qualified URI.
        enabled - The requested value of the feature (true or false).
        Returns:
        A new XmlConfig instance
        See Also:
        XMLReader.setFeature(java.lang.String, boolean)

      • property

        public XmlConfig property(String name,
                          Object value)
        Set a value of a property.
        Parameters:
        name - The property name.
        value - The requested value of the feature (true or false).
        Returns:
        A new XmlConfig instance
        See Also:
        XMLReader.setFeature(java.lang.String, boolean)

      • declaredNamespaces

        public Map<String,String> declaredNamespaces()
        Returns:
        A map containing namespaces that will be used by the underlying XmlSlurper.
        See Also:
        XMLReader.setFeature(java.lang.String, boolean)

      • declareNamespaces

        public XmlConfig declareNamespaces(Map<String,String> namespacesToDeclare)
        Specify declared namespaces that will be used when parsing XML. Will also set namespaceAware(boolean) to true of namespaces are not empty.

        Note that you cannot use this to add namespaces for the org.hamcrest.xml.HasXPath matcher. This has to be done by providing a NamespaceContext to the matcher instance.

        Parameters:
        namespacesToDeclare - A map containing features that will be used by the underlying XmlSlurper.
        Returns:
        A new instance of XmlConfig
        See Also:
        XMLReader.setFeature(java.lang.String, boolean)

      • declareNamespace

        public XmlConfig declareNamespace(String prefix,
                                  String namespaceURI)
        Declares a namespace and also sets namespaceAware(boolean) to true.

        Note that you cannot use this to add namespaces for the org.hamcrest.xml.HasXPath matcher. This has to be done by providing a NamespaceContext to the matcher instance.

        Parameters:
        prefix - The feature name, which is a fully-qualified URI.
        namespaceURI - The requested value of the feature (true or false).
        Returns:
        A new XmlConfig instance
        See Also:
        XMLReader.setFeature(java.lang.String, boolean)

      • disableLoadingOfExternalDtd

        public XmlConfig disableLoadingOfExternalDtd()
        Disables external DTD loading.

        This is a shortcut for doing:

         setFeature("http://apache.org/xml/features/nonvalidating/load-external-dtd", false);

        Returns:
        A new XmlConfig instance
        See Also:
        feature(String, boolean)

      • namespaceAware

        public XmlConfig namespaceAware(boolean shouldBeAwareOfNamespaces)
        Configure whether or not REST Assured should be aware of namespaces when parsing XML.
        Parameters:
        shouldBeAwareOfNamespaces - true if xml parsing should take namespaces into account.
        Returns:
        A new XmlConfig instance

      • isNamespaceAware

        public boolean isNamespaceAware()
        Returns:
        true if REST Assured should be namespace aware.

      • with

        public XmlConfig with()
        For syntactic sugar.
        Returns:
        The same XmlConfig instance

      • and

        public XmlConfig and()
        For syntactic sugar.
        Returns:
        The same XmlConfig instance

      • xmlConfig

        public static XmlConfig xmlConfig()
        Returns:
        A static way to create a new XmlConfig instance without calling "new" explicitly. Mainly for syntactic sugar.

      • isUserConfigured

        public boolean isUserConfigured()
        Specified by:
        isUserConfigured in interface Config
        Returns:
        true if this config instance has been explicitly configured by the user, false if it has the default values.
